title.narrative: WB Water Resources and Irrigation Project (WRIP)

description.narrative: Det föreslagna projektet kommer att bestå av komponenter som behandlar 1) Reneovering av bevattningsystem 2) Institutionellt och produktivt stöd för bevattning och dränering 3) Institutionellt stöd till för integrerad vattenförvaltning och 4) Genomförande stöd. Genomförande-parters kommer att vara Jordbruksministeriet och Miljöministeriet. Sverige stödjer fra komp 3, dvs EU:s Vattendirektiv

The proposed project will comprise components dealing with 1) Irrigation systems rehabilitation 2) Institutional and productive support for irrigation and drainage 3) Institutional support to for Integrated Water Resources Management and 4) Implementation support. Implementation partners will be Min of Agriculture and Min of Environment. Sweden to support Component 3 which relates to EU WFD

participating-org.narrative: IBRD/International Bank for Reconstruction and Development/The World Bank
International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

sector.narrative: Water sector policy and administrative management

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2016Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: Rehabilitation of 11 dams has been completed and modernizations of four irrigations sites are in good progress. Site specific Social Safeguards and Social Development aspects have been discussed for each dam and monitoring is done by external consultant. The Ministry has carried out stakeholder consultation and public hearing with the beneficiaries of the schemes whereby the beneficiaries are informed about the planned works. Rehabilitation of the schemes will improve reliability of the irrigation-water supply and thus facilitate a switch to more-profitable crops. In connection with a Territorial Reform in 2015 with aggregations of, on average 10 communes to one, it has been decided to transfer the tenure of the irrigation infrastructure to the new municipalities. It is major challenge to establish sufficient capacity in the new municipalities and a legal framework adapted to the change in the institutional setting. The project is timely and will support sustainable irrigation designs management to help in developing/experimenting the irrigation-related bylaws/procedures under the new national laws. The data base design and soft- and hardware has been procured for a national Water Cadaster and training is ongoing with participants from various institutions wo will make inputs and make use of the WC. Two licenses are also procured for elaborating forecasting water availability and flooding. The Integrated Water Resources Management (IWRM) project implemented by an International Consultant procured by the Ministry is expected to present a report before the end of the agreement October first 2016. River Basin Management Plans is being prepared for Semani and Drin-Buna river scheduled to be available within a year which as a delay by more than a year. The project will also assist the Ministry to establish a database to follow up its activities. The intervention logic is that the project will reduce vulnerability for floods and water shortage linked to climate change.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
